intro: Ficus quangtriensis, commonly known as the Quang Tri fig, is a rare species of flowering plant native to Vietnam. It belongs to the Moraceae family and is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and unique fruiting structures. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine, though its ecological role remains understudied. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
